content.question: The excerpt shown is in A minor. Which of the following statements provides the most accurate analysis of the boxed chord?

choices.label: It is a ⅶo7/Ⅵ tonicizing F major; the F in the bass is an anticipation.
It is a Ⅴ7/Ⅴ tonicizing E major; the F in the bass is the fifth of the triad.
It is a ⅶo7/ⅳ tonicizing D minor; the F in the bass is an anticipation.
It is a Ⅴ7/VI tonicizing F major; the F in the bass is a retardation.

content.answer: It is a ⅶo7/Ⅵ tonicizing F major; the F in the bass is an anticipation.

unit.text: 7: Harmony and Voice Leading IV - Secondary Function

topic.text: 7.3: Tonicization through Secondary Leading Tone Chords

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in notated music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
